Tucson could see that there was no time to return to base.  He looks around=
 and finds a familiar cave.  They had walked a bit of a distance uphill and=
 he knew exactly where they were.   The cave behind him is enormous, and an=
 old silver scale lies on the ground next to the opening.  The young female=
 he had seen earlier, pops her head out and senses that Talon is in need of=
 her protective services while giving birth.  She calls to her in quiet bel=
lows.

" It's alright Talon, she's calling to you, to follow her.  Female d=
ragons always colonize around their own to protect a new mother and her new=
borns. "

It was as he explained.  The females gather around Talon and show=
 her to a place where she can have her baby, on a soft bed of discarded fea=
thers and grasses.  Tucson is gently nudged outside since males are not all=
owed inside until after the birth.  He waits outside with another older dra=
gon.

" Wait, please, she's my wife, I have to be there with her."

He trie=
s to go inside but is blocked by an older female.  He lowers his head and b=
acks up a slight.

ck. And if it is a physical being, it must be stopped. And I have a feeling=

his pictograph gives a location.. Ah, I got it, these paintings resemble a =
path that I happen to know rather well. And some of this writing.. I think =
it means " Blight" . Tucson to base, over. I have identified an enemy, via =
pictograph images found on my location. The name of our new enemy is Blight=
, and by the look of the pictographs, he is a Predacon. I will proceed to l=
ocate Blight now . Or at least get him to heed my warning. Tucson out."

> > > > > > > > " So will I. Talon, =
so will I. But that doesn't mean we can't try to recreate a little portion =
of life on our own planet. This seed we were given, it needs soil, water, l=
ight and something to plant it in. Perhaps we can find a place where there =
is an abundance of soil and take that with us. "
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > >=
 > > > Just as he spoke, a Protohuman, carrying an offering of fish, kneels=
 down before Tucson and Talon. Tucson looks to the offering. It was a most =
generous portion of fish. Yet now he could not eat it, but he knew Talon wo=
uld need nourishment. He nods gently to the Protohuman and accepts his offe=
ring with a gentile touch of his nose on the man's shoulder. He allows him =
to stroke his snout as some sort of good luck ritual. The man bows in graci=
ousness to Tucson's gesture of kindness and leaves him be with Talon.
> > >=
 > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > " I'm not so sure what all of that meant but, w=
hatever it was, it was a very kind gesture on his part. I wonder if these p=
eople had any interaction with the old Silver Dragon.. " 
> > > > > > > > 
=
> > > > > > > > It isn't long before others come to offer more gifts to him=
 and Talon. One of the Protohumans points to a painting on a rock, with whi=
te portraying silver, in a primitive image of a large reptile with outstret=
ched wings.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > " Oh, I see now.. Yes, they ha=
ve seen him before. To them he is a guardian, and the more offerings they g=
ave him, he would return their kind gestures by offering his protection. Bu=
t there is more to these paintings.. A strange mysterious figure, with an a=
ura around it.. To me it seems evil. Another idol, someone else to worship.=
 .. People portrayed in black and white.. White, meaning those who look to =
the Silver Dragon and black to those who worship the intimidating idol.. I'=
ve seen ancient pictographs before on Cybertron, and these are different bu=
t in the same format. Talon if the dragon is a physical being, then this da=
rk idol must be as well. We need to find it, before it lays harm to anyone.=
"

> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > With a ge=
ntile smile, Tucson returns the kiss and holds his wing over them to provid=
e a moment alone with Talon. After the kiss he lowers his wing and notices =
that a collection of small creatures surrounding him and Talon . Yet they d=
o so in a fashion of admiration rather than hostility. Tucson looks to them=
 curiously.
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > " I'm not sure why the=
se creatures are curious about us but it appears as if they're here to admi=
re rather than attack. I wonder... "
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > >=
 > He stands up and gets back into beast mode, and sits down once more. The=
 creatures draw closer to him and sit beside him and Talon. It was clear th=
at the Silver Dragon was a source of comfort to these creatures, but that w=
as about to change once he and Talon left for Cybertron. It was a massive g=
uilt slammed upon his heart. Yet how could he get the animals to understand=
 that he had to leave them in such a short time? He was now their guardian =
and they were looking up to him for protection. 
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > >=
 > > > > > > > " Talon, these creatures remember the old dragon that sought=
 to their protection and realize that I have taken his place. It's as I tho=
ught, they aren't aware of who we really are, and where we are from. They w=
ill not understand that we must leave them shortly, for good, and Primus kn=
ows what will happen to them once we leave. ... Talon, I hear something com=
ing. It's not a Predacon but it's a fairly large creature."
> > > > > > > >=
 > > 
> > > > > > > > > > Not far from them, Tucson spots the scales of a r=
ather large reptile, that appears to be fishing in the stream next to them.=
 He watches attentively and at that moment, the creature lifts its head. It=
 was another dragon. Yet this one was a bit smaller than he was, but the sa=
me coloration. He takes note of its slender shape. It was female. She looks=
 to him as he looks to her. She slowly approaches him and they look gently =
to each other like brother and sister. In draconic vocalization, Tucson exp=
lains who he is and his dilemma. She intern rumbles back and bows her head.=
 She nods as he does. It was their way of communicating as Tucson looks bac=
k to Talon.
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > " Apparently the old d=
ragon has family here. They are scattered but they exist. And she said that=
 she will protect these creatures and this land along with her brethren for=
 as long as they live. And she wishes us good luck on our journey."
> > > >=
 > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > With that, the dragoness leaves them peac=
efully to enjoy their time together. With a gentile groan, the creatures to=
o, depart. It was truly a spiritual moment for both of them.

> > > > >=
 > > > > > > >

m around her shoulders. He looks up and then back to her.
> > > > > > > > >=
 > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > > " Like a branch on a tree that has broken o=
ff during a storm and regrows in a different direction than it had been, be=
fore it had broken off. I know exactly how you feel. I feel the same way. A=
t one time, I was blind, rolled on four wheels and I always seemed to be an=
 Autobot rebel. I fought along side with my comrades but I wasn't good at f=
ollowing orders. I was well grounded but lost at the same time. Then, I met=
 you and things began to change on a more positive note. You may not believ=
e this, but you helped me to find my path, and you saw me on the right road=
 and guided me to my true fate. Soon afterwards, I became a Prime, acquired=
 seventeen more wheels, and almost looked like Optimus Prime, yet different=
. But one thing didn't change, I was still battling blindness off and on. T=
hen, a third change, due to extensive damage to my previous form, which cou=
ld not be repaired, I was guided to my final evolution, this one. All of th=
ese things wouldn't have come about if I had never met you. And I wouldn't =
have it any other way. Talon, I will miss this planet as much as you are, a=
nd hopefully we can tell our offspring all about this planet and it's wondr=
ous varieties of life that live here."
> > > > > > > > > > > >

ters to him.
> > > > > > > > > > > >

 us to keep? Thank you, we will take good care of it."

 > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > > " I think we have a way to bring back=
 a small reminder of this planet. Let's see if we can encourage it to grow =
on ours."

re was no time to return to base.  He looks around and finds a familia=
r cave.  They had walked a bit of a distance uphill and he knew exactl=
y where they were.   The cave behind him is enormous, and an old silve=
r scale lies on the ground next to the opening.  The young female he h=
ad seen earlier, pops her head out and senses that Talon is in need of her =
protective services while giving birth.  She calls to her in quiet bel=
lows.</div><div><br></div><div>" It's alright Talon, she's calling to you, =
to follow her.  Female dragons always colonize around their own to pro=
tect a new mother and her newborns. "</div><div><br></div><div>It was as he=
 explained.  The females gather around Talon and show her to a place w=
here she can have her baby, on a soft bed of discarded feathers and grasses=
.  Tucson is gently nudged outside since males are not allowed inside =
until after the birth.  He waits outside with another older dragon.</d=
